content:
=== Game Rules ===
This is vgdl rule file:
BasicGame square_size=32
    SpriteSet
        background > Immovable img=oryx/space1 hidden=True
        base    > Immovable    color=WHITE img=oryx/planet
        avatar  > FlakAvatar   stype=sam img=oryx/spaceship1
        missile > Missile
            sam  > orientation=UP    color=BLUE singleton=True img=oryx/bullet1
            bomb > orientation=DOWN  color=RED  speed=0.5 img=oryx/bullet2
        alien   > Bomber       stype=bomb   prob=0.01  cooldown=3 speed=0.8
            alienGreen > img=oryx/alien3
            alienBlue > img=oryx/alien1
        portal  > invisible=True hidden=True
        	portalSlow  > SpawnPoint   stype=alienBlue  cooldown=16   total=20 img=portal
        	portalFast  > SpawnPoint   stype=alienGreen  cooldown=12   total=20 img=portal

    LevelMapping
        . > background
        0 > background base
        1 > background portalSlow
        2 > background portalFast
        A > background avatar

    TerminationSet
        SpriteCounter      stype=avatar               limit=0 win=False
        MultiSpriteCounter stype1=portal stype2=alien limit=0 win=True

    InteractionSet
        avatar  EOS  > stepBack
        alien   EOS  > turnAround
        missile EOS  > killSprite

        base bomb > killBoth
        base sam > killBoth scoreChange=1

        base   alien > killSprite
        avatar alien > killSprite scoreChange=-1
        avatar bomb  > killSprite scoreChange=-1
        alien  sam   > killSprite scoreChange=2

This is vgdl rule in natural language:
Here's an analysis of the game based on the provided rules:

1. Game Genre and Theme:
 • It’s a space-themed arcade shooter. You control a spaceship (the "avatar") in an environment filled with enemy aliens, bombs, and a base (planet) that you defend.
 • The visuals include a space background and various moving sprites like aliens, missiles, bombs, and spawn portals.

2. Key Mechanics:
 • Movement and Firing: You maneuver your spaceship (avatar) and fire missiles (sam) to shoot down enemy aliens.
 • Enemy Behavior: Enemies (aliens) are spawned from invisible portals (portalSlow and portalFast). They move across the screen, sometimes dropping bombs that head downward.
 • Collisions and Interactions: Various sprites interact when they meet:
  – If your missile hits the edge of the screen (EOS), it disappears.
  – Collisions between your avatar and alien or bomb result in negative consequences (penalties or sprite eliminations).
  – Interestingly, when your base interacts with your missile ("base sam"), both are destroyed while you receive a score bonus, suggesting a trade‐off or special mechanic.
  – The base also interacts with enemy objects: for instance, if a bomb hits the base, both are destroyed, but if an alien hits the base, only the alien is eliminated.
  – Note that aliens colliding with your missile not only result in the alien disappearing but they also boost your score.
 
3. Objective and Win/Loss Conditions:
 • Primary Goal: Eliminate all enemy aliens and their spawn portals.
 • Win Condition: You win when no aliens and no portals remain, meaning you’ve successfully cleared the enemy forces.
 • Loss Condition: If your avatar (spaceship) is eliminated (the sprite counter for the avatar reaches zero), you lose the game.

4. Overall Strategy:
 • Stay on the Move: Constantly maneuver your avatar to avoid enemy bombs and avoid direct collisions with aliens. Getting hit not only costs you points but can also lead to losing your ship.
 • Prioritize Threats: Target the enemy spawn points (portals) early since they continuously produce more aliens. Taking them out will help lessen the enemy onslaught over time.
 • Engage at a Distance: Use your missiles (sam) wisely to attack aliens from afar. This helps you rack up points (particularly since an alien and missile collision gives a scorebonus) while keeping out of harm’s way.
 • Protect Your Base: Since the base can interact with both friendly and enemy projectiles, be mindful of its position. While it might sometimes help you score (for example, base and missile collisions yield positive points), you must also prevent enemy bombs from hitting it.
 • Balance Offense and Defense: While aggressive targeting of aliens is important, always keep an eye on incoming hazards. Avoid reckless maneuvers that might bring you into contact with enemy bombs or cause collisions that reduce your score.

In summary, you’re piloting a spaceship in a fast-paced, strategic shooter where every movement and shot counts. Efficiently managing threats by targeting spawn points and dodging enemy attacks is crucial. Stick to a strategy that combines quick reflexes with careful shooting to protect both your ship and base, ensuring you eliminate the enemy forces completely before they overwhelm you. Enjoy the challenge in outer space!

You are an intelligent player playing a video game, and you have a friend provide you strategy. Interpret the state, rule, strategy and act accordingly. Notice that your avatar position is one of the most important information, if the position doesn't change from the last state, you need to analyze the state and make a different action from the last time.

=== Available Actions ===
0: ACTION_NIL
1: ACTION_USE
2: ACTION_LEFT
3: ACTION_RIGHT

=== Feedback === 


Evaluation: GOOD 
Feedback: Action 1 successfully moved the avatar to join sam, as indicated by the cell containing "avatar sam". This move directly fulfills the objective of uniting with sam without incurring any risk, making it a strategically sound decision with a reward of 0.0 from the environment

=== Important Mechanics Notice ===
 In some games, directional actions (LEFT, RIGHT, UP, DOWN) may first cause the avatar to rotate toward the intended direction without immediately moving. If the avatar's position does not change after a directional action, it may indicate a rotation has occurred. To proceed, you must apply the directional action again after rotation. Always verify whether the avatar actually moved after each action. Please understand the rule and the interaction set first, then locate the item, finally choose a meaningful action towards the win and respond in the format: ``` Action:<action number> ```. Include one sentence of feedback on the action and your expectation to see if it aligns with the strategy. Notice, Action 0 will not reasult in any change in this game environment, and you may need to understand the level layout first to play the game. 

=== Sprite Mapping ===
avatar -> 'a'
background -> '.'
background base -> '0'
background portalSlow -> '1'
background portalFast -> '2'
alienBlue -> '@'
base -> '#'
sam -> '$'
alienBlue bomb -> '%'
bomb -> '&'
bomb sam -> '*'

=== Current State ===

===Long-term Plan===
```**avatar strategy: Leverage the current union of avatar and sam to enable missile synergy against enemy spawn portals—systematically batch-process portalSlow and portalFast to neutralize alienBlue threats while preserving the base** without **Alert**```

Action:1

I'm using the ACTION_USE command to fire the missile upward toward the two aliens above, expecting to hit and eliminate them in line with our missile synergy strategy.
